dlgLine.text: What's up?

dlgAnsw.text: Anything that would improve your mood?
You've got to stop bothering Aggro.
About Aggro...
About your listeners - we checked out all the locations.
I have your CDs and the fuel you wanted.
Got a question for you.
Nothing at the moment. We'll talk later.

dlgLine.text: I'm listening.

dlgAnsw.text: I never thanked you for all your help over the radio.
You talked to people out there - did anyone hear anything about other areas or a cure?
What are your skills? I need to know what to put you on here.
What would improve the shelter for you?
Nothing comes to mind. We'll talk more later.

dlgLine.text: Oh, sure... You know, I didn't really know what I was doing at first but then it became a calling, I guess. And a lifeline, too.
But mainly I just wanted to play songs I liked on the radio, and it only took the end of the world for that to happen. Anyhow, I'm glad it was helpful to someone.

dlgAnsw.text: Another question.
Just wanted to let you know. Talk to you later.

dlgLine.text: Most of the people I talked to were busy trying to find their next meal. But I heard lots of things... people claiming to have had phone calls from relatives in states that were safe, that they had met someone who had been cured, that the infection had burnt out in other countries.

But you can't take that stuff seriously. Some of those same people just casually mentioned alien sightings and shadow government conspiracies in those same conversations. Stress and radio anonymity makes people say weird shit.

dlgAnsw.text: Hmm... I had another question.
I understand your skepticism. I'll talk to you later.

dlgLine.text: Pretty much everything. Gone from shittier to worse radio stations to the point where I had to do my own repairs on the console. I got a gun a few years ago and I used to go to the range pretty frequently.
I don't know - where do you need me? I've had so many jobs over the years that I can probably do something right.

dlgAnsw.text: That helps. Another question...
I'll think of something - tell you more later.

dlgLine.text: A target range for sure. Helps me relieve stress, and let's face it when your life is one missed headshot from being over, I want to get in as much practice as possible.
And I'd feel more comfortable if everyone got in a few shots now and again so that the last thing I hear isn't 'oops!'

dlgAnsw.text: I'll see what we can do. Another question...
Good point. I should go and see about getting that set up.

dlgLine.text: Good to go? Shouldn't your thumbs be up?

dlgAnsw.text: She didn't seem enthusiastic. Maybe you need to convince her yourself.
She's not interested. Sorry.
She seems like a bitch. You don't want that, trust me.
Just drop it. Stay away from her.

dlgLine.text: Huh... I guess I should stop crushing on her and just try talking to her. Sorry about all this - I tend to build up these things in my head and then I get all nervous that reality isn't going to live up to my expectations.
Thanks for all this, though - good to know I can count on you. Now if you'll excuse me, I'm going to try not to be myself and see if charming comes out - later.

dlgAnsw.text: No problem. Good luck.
Please leave me out for now on, okay? See ya.

dlgLine.text: What? C'mon - did you even try? I'm like the only guy that appreciates her music here. Gosh - that was really stupid of me.

dlgAnsw.text: Don't beat yourself up.
No, I think she's just not into you. Get over it.
You're on your own from here. I did all I could.

dlgLine.text: Beat myself up? No, I meant it was stupid to send someone else. I just need to stop being an idiot and go tell her how I feel. Anyhow - thanks, for your help. I'll tell you how things went later.

dlgAnsw.text: Okay, you do that. See ya.
Whatever. Later.

dlgLine.text: She's a musician - that's how they all seem. I'm sure underneath all of it, she's naked... I mean, normal. I should just talk to her.

dlgAnsw.text: Maybe you should.
Okay - truth time. She used words like 'never' - I was trying to be nice.

dlgLine.text: Really? That's... I mean, I thought with her being indie as fuck and me being into her music and... that just seems harsh - no, fucking unbearable.
Wait, no... officially the shittiest situation I have ever been in. Life just likes to dangle the carrot before it stabs me in the eye with it...

dlgAnsw.text: Maybe you should talk to her...
I don't know - do what the hell you want. Leave me out of it.
Sorry, Lane. I wish it had worked out for you.
Please drop this, Lane. Seems like you got your answer.
Give it a few days. Maybe she'll change her mind.

dlgLine.text: You know - I will. It's the end of the world, right? What have I got to lose? Anyhow - thanks for the help. I owe you... but first I gotta go set some things straight. Later.

dlgAnsw.text: Okay, you do that. See ya.
Whatever. Later.

dlgLine.text: Yeah... No, you really tried to help I know...

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -
- New Answ -

dlgLine.text: I guess there could always be another girl in a band out there - I mean, Austin's close. Yeah... maybe. <Sigh>

dlgAnsw.text: <Lane folds his arms and seems to have ended the conversation.>

dlgLine.text: Well, I guess there's always Regina...

Don't laugh - I could just imagine her just picking me up and holding me like a baby in those big, muscular arms of hers, taking me off to the hills to have her way with me until I break... Yeah, that sounds nice...
I guess... <Sigh>

dlgAnsw.text: <Lane folds his arms and seems to have ended the conversation.>

dlgLine.text: Whaaaat? I've talked with her, same as anyone here. What did she tell you?

dlgAnsw.text: All I know is she said you're bugging her. Whatever you're doing, cut it out.
Alright - let's hear your side of the story.
Real simple - stay away from her or I'll kick your fucking ass. Understood?
Lane, please keep your distance before this escalates, okay?

dlgLine.text: I don't know what she means by that, but I'm not doing anything weird, unless you call occupying space in the same building a crime. What does she want me to do - move out into the yard or something?

dlgAnsw.text: Fine. Just try to give her some space, okay?
Eh, maybe she's overreacting.
I'm serious - stay the hell away from her or else. And yes, that's a threat.
Lane, please keep your distance before this escalates, okay?

dlgLine.text: I see her in the cafeteria and maybe make small talk - just like anyone. Sometimes I have to work with her, which requires communication. Occasionally I'll see her waiting in line for the bathroom and nod in her direction. Nothing weird.

dlgAnsw.text: Fine. Just try to give her some space, okay?
Eh, maybe she's overreacting.
Bullshit. You're harassing her and it ends right now. Got it?!
Lane, please keep your distance before this escalates, okay?

dlgLine.text: Okay, whatever... I'm done with this inquisition. Later.

dlgAnsw.text: <Lane seems upset and doesn't want to talk anymore.>

dlgLine.text: Whoa... Okay, I got it. Fuck her and fuck you too!
Sorry I inconvenienced everyone with my existing. I won't say another word to that crazy bitch. Man...

dlgAnsw.text: <Lane doesn't seem to want to talk anymore.>

dlgLine.text: You think?
Man... Try to be a nice guy and look where it gets you. Now, if you'll excuse me, it's feeling a bit awkward in here.

dlgAnsw.text: <Lane seems upset and doesn't want to talk anymore.>

dlgLine.text: Right, okay - fine.... If she's going to be a psycho about it, I'll do my best to avoid her.
Man, fuck my life...

dlgAnsw.text: <Lane doesn't seem to want to talk anymore.>

dlgLine.text: I know what you're going to say. They're gone. It's pretty obvious...

dlgAnsw.text: I'm sorry. I'm so sorry, Lane.
Yeah...
I told you it was a waste of time.

dlgLine.text: Maybe... I don't know, I wanted to believe they were there still... Fuck me, I'm sorry I inconvenienced you, okay?

dlgAnsw.text: Here's what I found...

dlgLine.text: So... enlighten me. How did they go?

dlgAnsw.text: Here's what I found...

dlgLine.text: Huh. So May killed herself after getting bit... sorry, May. No sign of Tommy or his daughter... maybe there's hope. And Frank, killed by his neighbor... that's just mean.
I'm going to take a moment to remember them... Thanks for looking for them, all the same. I just wish it had turned out differently.

dlgAnsw.text: <Lane wants to be left alone.>

dlgLine.text: Let's see what you got... yup, those are obscure enough to be mine. I can work with this.
I'll set up a table in the cafeteria and properly set the roof on fire. I'll do an all-day set, so that means I won't be available for anything else, but this will boost morale, I promise.

dlgAnsw.text: Sounds good. I'm sure it will boost morale.
Not my thing, but I hope it works. See ya.

dlgLine.text: What did I miss most in the radio station? That would be hot sauce to put on just about everything and coffee, because why am I not drinking it right now?

dlgAnsw.text: Here's a bottle of hot sauce.
Here's a bag of good coffee beans.
I'll take a look at what we have.

dlgLine.text: I could drink this stuff straight. I used to order half-gallons of it online. Remember when we could do that? Yeah...

dlgAnsw.text: Enjoy it. See ya.
Gross. But if it helps, I'm glad.

dlgLine.text: Yes... I'm going to drink this until my pee smells like coffee. That's the best.

dlgAnsw.text: Yeah... Okay, see ya.
Jeez... Whatever, enjoy.
